N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 §§ 713-3.11 - Occupational therapy facilities

State Regulations

Occupational therapy facilities shall include and
comply with the following: (a) An
activities area with space and equipment commensurate with department approved
programs. Provision shall be made for sink or lavatory, and facilities for
collection of waste products prior to disposal. (b) Storage for supplies and
equipment. (c) Residents' toilet
rooms that may be shared with residents receiving physical therapy residents if
the approved narrative program reflects this sharing concept. (d) If there is an approved adult day health
care program, operating on premises, the department may require that additional
space and equipment be provided. Notes
